titles.title: Supercritical Advanced Coal Project Incentive Act of 2012
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow additional investment credits for qualifying supercritical advanced coal projects.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 4/26/2012--Introduced. Supercritical Advanced Coal Project Incentive Act of 2012 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to expand the tax credit for investment in qualifying advanced coal projects to include a credit for supercritical advanced coal-based generation technology projects. Defines such projects as including a coal-fired boiler that reaches an electricity generating efficiency of at least 36%, and operates at a minimum pressure of 3,200 pounds per square inch. Increases from $2.55 billion to $3.8 billion the aggregate amount of credits allowable for qualifying advanced coal projects, and includes within that aggregate amount a maximum $1.25 billion credit amount for supercritical advanced coal-based generation technology projects.
